nistRequirement: a. Establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for mobile devices. b. Authorize the connection of mobile devices to the system. c. Implement full-device or container-based encryption to protect the confidentiality of CUI on mobile devices.

settings.displayName: Require Full Device Encryption on Mobile Devices
settings.description: Mandates full-device encryption on all mobile devices (iOS, Android, Windows) before allowing access to organizational resources. iOS devices are automatically encrypted when a passcode is set; Android Enterprise enforces encryption by default. This protects CUI confidentiality if devices are lost or stolen.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. In Intune admin center, navigate to Devices > Compliance policies
2. Create platform-specific compliance policies:
   - iOS/iPadOS: Under 'System Security', set 'Require' for password (encryption automatic)
   - Android Enterprise: Encryption enforced by default, verify setting
   - Windows: Set 'Require' for 'Encryption of data storage on device'
3. Configure Actions for noncompliance:
   - Immediately mark as noncompliant
   - Send notification to user
   - Block access after 1 day grace period
4. Assign policies to 'All users' or mobile device groups
5. For Windows, consider deploying BitLocker configuration profile
6. Monitor compliance status and remediation
7. Document exceptions for devices that cannot support encryption

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Directly implements requirement (c) to implement full-device encryption to protect CUI confidentiality on mobile devices. Ensures data at rest is protected using platform-native encryption (iOS Data Protection, Android FBE/FDE, Windows BitLocker).

settings.displayName: Enforce Minimum OS Version for Mobile Devices
settings.description: Requires mobile devices to run at minimum the N-1 (current minus one) major OS version to ensure security patches and encryption capabilities are current. Prevents outdated devices with known vulnerabilities from accessing systems with CUI.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Determine current OS versions: iOS 18/17, Android 14/13, Windows 11/10
2. In Intune compliance policies, configure:
   - iOS: Set 'Minimum OS version' to iOS 17.0 (if iOS 18 is current)
   - Android: Set 'Minimum OS version' to Android 13.0 (if Android 14 is current)
   - Windows: Set 'Minimum OS version' to 10.0.19045 (22H2) or Windows 11
3. Under Actions for noncompliance:
   - Grace period: 7 days for user remediation
   - Send notification with upgrade instructions
   - Block access after grace period
4. Assign to mobile device groups
5. Review and update quarterly as new OS versions release
6. Monitor devices blocked for OS version
7. Plan device refresh cycle for unsupported hardware

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Supports requirements (a) and (b) by establishing configuration requirements and authorizing only devices meeting minimum security standards. Current OS versions ensure encryption features, security patches, and secure boot capabilities are available.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: 03.01.18.a,b - Establish configuration requirements and authorize mobile device connections

settings.displayName: Require Strong Passcode on Mobile Devices
settings.description: Enforces strong passcode requirements on mobile devices including minimum length, complexity (alphanumeric), and automatic lock timeout. Passcodes activate device encryption and prevent unauthorized physical access to devices containing CUI.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Create or edit device compliance policy for each platform
2. Under System Security > Password section, configure:
   - iOS/Android/Windows: Set 'Require a password' to 'Require'
   - 'Required password type': Alphanumeric
   - 'Minimum password length': 8 characters
   - 'Simple passwords': Block
   - 'Maximum minutes of inactivity before password required': 15 minutes
   - 'Password expiration (days)': 365 (or per policy)
   - 'Number of previous passwords to prevent reuse': 5
3. Configure device lock settings in device configuration profile:
   - iOS: Device lock after 15 minutes
   - Android: Screen timeout 15 minutes
   - Windows: Lock screen timeout 15 minutes
4. Test policy enforcement on test devices
5. Deploy to production mobile device groups
6. Monitor compliance and password change events

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Implements configuration requirement (a) and encryption requirement (c). Strong passcodes are required to activate device encryption on iOS and protect encrypted data on all platforms. Also prevents unauthorized physical access to mobile devices.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: 03.01.18.a,c - Establish configuration requirements and enable encryption

settings.displayName: Require Compliant or Hybrid Joined Device for Mobile Access
settings.description: Requires mobile devices to be Intune-compliant or hybrid Azure AD joined before accessing organizational resources. This enforces centralized authorization of mobile device connections and ensures only managed, secure devices can access systems with CUI.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Microsoft Entra admin center
2. Navigate to Protection > Conditional Access > Policies
3. Create new policy: 'Require Compliant Mobile Devices'
4. Assignments:
   - Users: All users (exclude break-glass and service accounts)
   - Target resources: All cloud apps
   - Conditions > Device platforms: Select 'iOS', 'Android', 'Windows Phone'
5. Access controls > Grant:
   - Select 'Grant access'
   - Require one of the selected controls:
     * 'Require device to be marked as compliant'
     * 'Require Hybrid Azure AD joined device'
6. Session: Not configured (or as needed)
7. Enable policy in 'Report-only' mode initially
8. Test with mobile devices on all platforms
9. Review sign-in logs for 7-14 days
10. Switch to 'On' when validated
11. Monitor ongoing sign-in reports for blocks

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Directly enforces requirement (b) to authorize mobile device connections to the system. Conditional Access provides centralized authorization control that verifies device compliance status before granting access to organizational resources.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: 03.01.18.b - Authorize the connection of mobile devices to the system

settings.displayName: Require App Protection Policies for CUI Access
settings.description: Implements container-based encryption and data protection through Intune App Protection Policies (MAM). Encrypts organizational data within managed apps independent of device encryption, implements copy/paste restrictions, and prevents data leakage to unmanaged apps. Critical for BYOD scenarios.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. In Intune admin center, navigate to Apps > App protection policies
2. Create policy for iOS/iPadOS:
   - Select apps: Outlook, Teams, OneDrive, Edge (Microsoft 365 apps)
   - Data protection settings:
     * Encrypt org data: Require
     * Send org data to other apps: Policy managed apps
     * Receive data from other apps: Policy managed apps
     * Save copies of org data: Block
     * Restrict cut, copy, paste: Policy managed apps
   - Access requirements:
     * PIN for access: Require
     * Work or school account credentials: Require
     * Biometrics: Allow (optional)
   - Conditional launch:
     * Min OS version: iOS 17.0
     * Max PIN attempts: 5
     * Offline grace period: 720 minutes
     * Jailbroken/rooted devices: Block access
3. Create similar policy for Android
4. Assign to user groups
5. Test with enrolled and unenrolled devices
6. Monitor app protection status in Intune
7. Review app protection reports weekly

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Implements container-based encryption alternative required by (c) to protect CUI confidentiality. App Protection Policies create encrypted containers for organizational data within apps, providing data protection on both enrolled and BYOD devices.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: 03.01.18.c - Implement container-based encryption to protect CUI

settings.description: Restricts mobile device enrollment to only corporate-owned devices, preventing personal BYOD devices from enrolling in Intune MDM. This ensures only authorized, organizationally-controlled devices can connect to systems with CUI. Organizations with BYOD programs should use App Protection Policies instead of full MDM enrollment.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. In Intune admin center, navigate to Devices > Enrollment
2. Select 'Enrollment device platform restrictions'
3. Create or edit restriction policy
4. For each platform (iOS, Android, Windows, macOS):
   - Set 'Personally owned devices' to 'Block'
   - Or set 'Platform' to 'Block' entirely for BYOD
5. Configure allowed enrollment types:
   - Corporate-owned only: User enrollment, Device enrollment
   - Block: Personal device enrollment
6. For corporate devices, use one of:
   - Apple Business Manager / Device Enrollment Program
   - Android Enterprise fully managed
   - Windows Autopilot
7. Assign restriction policy with priority 1 (highest)
8. Test enrollment with corporate vs personal devices
9. Document approved device procurement process
10. Review enrolled devices monthly for compliance

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Enforces requirements (a) and (b) by establishing strict usage restrictions that only corporate-owned devices can enroll and be authorized for connection. Prevents uncontrolled personal devices from accessing systems with CUI while allowing App Protection for BYOD scenarios.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: 03.01.18.a,b - Establish usage restrictions and authorize mobile device connections
